channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Private tree overhanging pavement, 18th November
item.description:
Private tree is overhanging pavement, on head height across almost the entire width of the pavement.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Formosa Street, Maida Vale, City of Westminster

item.title: Major flytipping in Lamlash Community Garden, 18th November
item.description:
It’s about time the Council did something about this persistent flytipping. It is local Residents from Elliotts Row and Brook Drive.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elliott's Row, Elephant and Castle, London Borough of Southwark

item.title: Rubbish constantly strewn all over Truman’s Road, 18th November
item.description:
As seems to be a weekly occurrence, there is rubbish that’s been spilt from the bin’s and generally a huge amount of litter strewn all over Truman’s Road - it’s along both pavements, in the road, alongside curbs… it’s vile and hasn’t been cleaned in days!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Salcombe Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: On the sidewalk in front of 12 Frognal Lane, 18th November
item.description:
There is an open hole there. The little round cover was broken and now it is gone entirely. Needs replacing- it is a hazard. Thanks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Frognal Lane, West Hampstead, Hampstead, London Borough of Camden
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No water to Information Centre, 18th November
item.description:
Following a visit to the Information Centre by a contractor, there has been no water to the centre. There is also no water to the community garden which is on the same pipework. This means there is no toilet facility or ability to wash hands or have a drink. The contractor are denying responsibility and suggesting it’s just a coincidence. Please could a contractor be sent out to check the water supply.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kelsey Park Avenue, Beckenham, Bromley, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Out side my window door, 18th November
item.description:
Every day people keep parking out side my window or door it’s not a car space I have pure anixty I have to them to stop I have been abused I have reported to police I have reporte tbis to Haringey council several times no reply nothing it is stressing me out it’s not fair as I pay rent and people are just parking outside my door it blocks all my lighting out. It’s not fair to live like this.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 57, North Road, Wood Green, London Borough of Haringey
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Limited nr of parking spaces due to paint, 18th November
item.description:
The nr of parking spaces on street has dramatically reduced due to parking areas implemented. How was this proposed for limitation in a busy area like this. Can we have access to the all the documents indicating the nr of cars in this area are dropping down?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Burcharbro Road, West Heath, Bexleyheath, London Borough of Bexley
Report on FixMyStreet
